oai_dc:dc.dc:title: THE INTERACTION OF DEEP-WATER GRAVITY WAVES AND A CURVED SHEARING CURRENT
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gerber, Marius
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: deep water
gravity wave
current
curved shearing current
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The interaction of steady deep-water gravity waves with a preexisting large-scale curved current has been investigated. In order to investigate the influence of the curvature of the current on the wave field, the current field was represented by a section of an annular current with a particular non-dimensional radius R. As a first approximation the interaction of a family of linear axi-symmetrical waves and the current was investigated. Exact linear ray solutions were obtained which, in the limit when R - Â«>, reduce to the analytical straight current solutions of Longuet- Higgins and Stewart (1961).
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 23 (1992): Proceedings of 23rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Venice, Italy, 1992.
